verbs.description: decentre (third-person singular simple present decentres, present participle decentring, simple past and past participle decentred)

entries.meaning: To remove the centre from. to decentre the tyres from some model vehicle kits.
(optics) To place away from the centre; to make eccentric.

examples: The Saidian critique was part of a great sea change, a conscious attempt to ‘decentre’ Europe or even to ‘provincialize’ it.
